text: Arkady Arkadyevich Babchenko (; born 18 March 1977) is a Russian journalist and war correspondent. He was a critic of President Vladimir Putin. He was born in Moscow. He temporarily left journalism and worked as a taxi driver for several years, but in January 2009 started working in Russian newspaper Novaya Gazeta. As a military correspondent, he followed the South Ossetia war in 2008.Russian journalist Arkady Babchenko is shot and killed in Kiev, Meduza (29 may 2018) Beginning in October 2017, Babchenko began working in Kyiv, the capital of Ukraine, for the TV channel ATR. Babchenko faked his own assassination at his Kyiv apartment on 29 May 2018 to arrest Russian spies who were plotting (or making a plan about) his assassination. However, the next day, he appeared alive at a press conference with the Security Service of Ukraine (SBU). According to the SBU the 'murder' had been staged to arrest his assassins, who were operating on orders by Russian security services. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1977 births Category:Living people Category:Russian journalists Category:Russian political writers Category:Writers from Moscow
